result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeris Lee Hoppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeris Lee Hoppe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeris Lee Hoppe was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Concurrent with Minnesota Probation.
Transfer back to Minnesota.
Court notes 65 days against ultimate sentence. 


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to Minnesota probation and Sentence

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF240.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF240.

***AMENDED***
Court will vacate the geographic restriction.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Coty Fleischauer, Barbara Nelson or her residence.
-Participate in any cognitive thinking program like MRT.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:

Per Judge Scott R. Needham September 29, 2016 - Court will IMPOSE 60 days condition time with remaining 4 months STAYED.
Court will authorize Huber.


Concurrent to Minnesota sentence.

Concurrent with: to Minnesota sentence

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham November 14, 2018 - amend credit.

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #15CF240.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #15CF240.

-Defendant to complete any cognitive programming.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Karl E. Anderson DF ATTY: Kirk Anderson DF: Jeris Lee Hoppe appeared from jail. Agent Natalie Volz appeared. Case called at 3:16. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Court reviews file. ADA Anderson gives sentencing argument. Atty. Anderson makes sentencing recommendations. DE makes statement. Court orders: 

5 years  6 months total confinement
2 years  6 months initial 
3 years ES with conditions:

- DE to complete any cognitive programming. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- AODA and any recommended follow through. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Costs to be paid during probation.

Court notes 354 days credit.
DE is remanded.
Adjustment Number: 18A 044177, Payable Number: 193737, Receipt Number: 18R 008373, Amount: $20.00

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle .DA:  Matthew Hartung DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Jeris Lee Hoppe appeared from jail. Case called at 11:14 a.m. ADA Hartung states ready for a plea today. Gives recommendations and has complied with victims rights. No restitution has been requested. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 without repeater modifier in 15CF240. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 dismissing repeater modifier in 15CF240 . Ct's 2 and 3 in case 15CF240 and 10CM370 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. Sentencing arguments. Both parties waiving PSI. Court will waive PSI. Defendant makes statement.  Crt orders:

-  S/W 3 years probation. Concurrent with MN probation. 6 months jail stayed concurrent to MN sentence. Transfer back to MN. 65 days jail credit against any ultimate sentence 

-  Not to enter the State of Wisconsin while on probation unless for a court matter

- 40 hours of community service

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Coty Fleischauer, Barbara Nelson or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Participate in any cognitive thinking program like MRT

- DNA Sample and Surcharge. 

- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid over the course of probation

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Barbara N. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
